10.m: Jesus said to him, 'I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.' - John 14:6 (ESV)

l.q: Why shouldn't the disciple's hearts be troubled?
l.a: Jesus commanded His disciples to believe in God and to believe in Him. He is leaving to prepare a place for them in His Father's house. And He will come back to take them to be with Him.

l.q: Who is our way to God, our Father?
l.a: Jesus Christ is our way to God, our Father.

l.q: Which verses describe Jesus' relationship with God, the Father?
l.a: In John 14:10-11, Jesus was telling his disciples that He is in the Father, and the Father is in Him.

l.q: What did Jesus command those who believe in Him?
l.a: Those who believe in Jesus will also do the works that He do. And whatever they ask in His name, Jesus will do, so that the Father will be glorified in Him.

l.q: Why then do we do good works?
l.a: We do good works so that God will be glorified.

s.h:
Pleased as man with men to dwell 
 Jesus, our Emmanuel

10.a: Enjoy a cup of warm chocolate or apple cider with someone who lives with you.
